tn.ref: with their faces to the ground
tn.text: This is a position of prayer. AT: "they prostrated themselves with their faces touching the stone pavement."
AT: "God's covenant faithfulness" or "God has promised to love the people of Israel forever"
AT: "each standing in there appointed place"

tn.ref: was not able to hold the burnt offerings
tn.text: AT: "was not able to hold the large amount of burnt offerings"
People from all over Israel came. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This was a special religious gathering.

tn.ref: the twenty-third day of the seventh month
tn.text: third day of the seventh month** - This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The twenty-third day is near the middle of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
The words "glad" and "joyful" mean basically the same thing. Together they emphasize the intensity of joy. AT: "with very glad hearts." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"finished"
AT: "I have listened to your prayer"

tn.ref: shut up the heavens so that there is no rain
tn.text: AT: "stopped the rain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The word "land" is used to mean "all the living plants and crops." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "search for God" or "try to get God to pay attention to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: my eyes will be open ... my ears attentive
tn.text: The words "eyes" and "ears" refer to God, who chooses to see and hear their prayers. AT: "I will see them and I will listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"My love, careful watch, and protection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: if you walk before me as David your father walked
tn.text: AT: "If you obey me as David, your father, did." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
AT: "I will make sure that your descendants will always be kings," (UDB)

tn.ref: I will uproot them from out of my ground that I have given them
tn.text: AT: "I will remove them from my land." Compares pulling plants up by their roots from the soil, with the removal of God's people of Israel from his land. The results would be destruction of the nation and sadness of the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"they were unfaithful to Yahweh" or "they did not obey Yahweh"

tn.ref: they laid hold of other gods and bowed down to them and worshiped them
tn.text: AT: "they have chosen to worship other gods and try to please them." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
